USOE-NAE8 UTILIZATION PROJECT
FILM 6; “EXAMPLES FROM THE SECONDARY SCHOOL"
OUTLINE OF FILM CONTENT
I. INTRODUCTION
A. Television camera as it turns to catch scene out of frame. (Narrator states
that television is a remarkable medium with a significant limitation.)
1. On television screen: Early Bird satellite OR moon shots OR astronaut
outside spacecraft. (NASA film clip) (Narrator states that television can
syphon the most inaccessible things...)
2. On television screen: Life metamorphosis process as it occurs.
(Narrator: ... the most immediate things...)
3. On television screen: Australian aboriginal legend - Brownie Downing
illustrating. (Narrator: ... the most intriguing things.. .into a message.)
4. Studio production seers from control room. (Narrator states that television
can carry that message fifty feet...)
5. Remote truck at special event. (Narrator: .. .five miles...)
6. Parabolic microwave antenna. (Narrator: .. .or five hundred miles...
across space.. .across time...)
7. Two students in classroom watching television lesson. (MCU) Teacher
visible. Eye...then ear.. .emphasis in camera angle. (Narrator:....
to the eye.. .to the ear.. .of a student in the classroom.)
B. Classroom scene.. .entire class and teacher.. .watching television lesson. (Narrator
says that television can carry the message no farther.. .that the student himself...
with the skilful! help of his teachers.. .must take it from there.)
C. Close up of student's head.. .emphasis on eye, ear, and brain locale. (Narrator
says that otherwise the message languishes.. „on the very threshold of his brain...
doomed to impotence. • .a scant three inches from learning.)
II. HEAD TITLES
INCLUDING FILM TITLE: "EXAMPLES FROM THE SECONDARY SCHOOL1
